name: ListWebhookSubscriptions
description:
Retrieve existing webhook subscriptions from PagerDuty.

Use this tool to list webhook subscriptions. It can filter subscriptions by service or team using `filter_type` and `filter_id` parameters. Useful for managing and configuring v3 webhooks. Requires 'webhook_subscriptions.read' permission.

parameters.name: accept_header
parameters.description: Specify the version of the API to use via the `Accept` header for request versioning.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of webhook subscription results to return per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: Offset to start the pagination of search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: resource_filter_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of resource to filter webhook subscriptions by, such as 'account', 'service', or 'team'.

value_schema.description: The type of resource to filter upon.

parameters.name: resource_filter_id
parameters.description: The ID of the resource to filter upon. Required if filtering by service or team.

value_schema.description: The id of the resource to filter upon. Required if filter_type is service or team.

parameters.name: include_total_in_pagination
parameters.description: Set to true to populate the `total` field in pagination responses. Useful if you need the total number of entries.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

parameters.name: filter_type
parameters.description: The type of resource to filter upon.

value_schema.description: The type of resource to filter upon.

parameters.name: filter_id
parameters.description: The id of the resource to filter upon. Required if filter_type is service or team.

value_schema.description: The id of the resource to filter upon. Required if filter_type is service or team.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.
